turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Proto-Tai language.
turn.1: What are the main languages spoken in Thailand?
turn.2: Proto-Tai language Proto-Tai is the reconstructed proto-language (common ancestor) of all the Tai languages, including modern Lao, Shan, Tai Lü, Tai Dam, Ahom, Northern Thai, Standard Thai, Bouyei, and Zhuang.
turn.3: Do people speak English in Thailand?
turn.4: The Proto-Tai language is not directly attested by any surviving texts, but has been reconstructed using the comparative method.
turn.5: When was the Proto-Tai language reconstructed?
turn.6: It was reconstructed in 1977 by Li Fang-Kuei and by Pittayawat Pittayaporn in 2009.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: The following table shows the consonants of Proto-Tai according to Li Fang-Kuei's "A Handbook of Comparative Tai" (1977), considered the standard reference in the field.

turn.10: Li does not indicate the exact quality of the consonants denoted here as [, and ], which are indicated in his work as [č, čh, ž] and described merely as palatal affricate consonants.
